Dignitaries gathered at heritage Rajbari to celebrate Poila Boishakh

Actress Priyanka Ghosh leads empowering seminar redefining beauty norms in Siliguri

Actress Priyanka Ghosh and hairstylist Jawed Habib collaborate in Siliguri for an empowering seminar that redefines beauty norms. The event showcases talented individuals from North Bengal and emphasizes the importance of empowering women in the makeup industry. Ghosh's dedication to recognizing and uplifting talent leaves an indelible mark on the future of the beauty and grooming sector in the nation, inspiring diversity and inclusivity.

Bengal’s Mehuli Ghosh clinches gold in 37th National Games

Bhowanipore Mallick Bari hosts a spectacular Legacy Concert

The Legacy Concert, held at the Bhowanipore Mallick Bari in Kolkata, celebrated the feminine divine through music and dance. The event featured performances by Sohini Roychowdhury and her troupe, as well as sitarist Indrajit Roychowdhury. The evening also included a talk on Shaktism and showcased various dance styles such as Bharatnatyam and Kathakali. The performances concluded with patriotic songs to mark India's 75th year of independence, leaving the audience overwhelmed with joy.

AN IMMERSIVE PLAY IN THE BYLANES OF JORASANKO

I was never a champ, but I never gave up either: Tota Roy Choudhury

Tota Roy Choudhury, a Bengali actor, is experiencing newfound fame after his performance as a Kathak dancer in Karan Johar's film. He reflects on the demand for Bengali actors in Mumbai and the inclusive casting in the industry. He believes being typecast is not necessarily a bad thing and emphasizes the importance of working with great directors. Tota also discusses the evolution of his career over the past three decades and expresses gratitude for the recognition he is receiving now.
